RecentTaskInfoProxy * mpProxy

Detailed Description

Information you can retrieve about tasks that the user has most recently started or visited.

Please check example sdk/example/PageManagerTest for more information 

  mCT = new Context(this);
  mPM = new PageManager(mCT);
  RecentTaskInfoArray array = mPM->getRecentTasks(NUM_RECENT_TASKS,
          PageManager::RECENT_WITH_EXCLUDED);
  Demand dm = array[0].getBaseDemand();

Member Function Documentation

Demand gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getBaseDemand ( )

The original Demand used to launch the task.

You can use this Demand to re-launch the task (if it is no longer running) or bring the current task to the front.

base::String gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getDescription ( )

Description of the task's last state.

int32_t gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getID ( )

If this task is currently running, this is the identifier for it.

If it is not running, this will be -1.

ComponentName gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getOrigPageName ( )

If this task was started from an alias, this is the actual page component that was initially started; the component of the baseDemand in this case is the name of the actual page implementation that the alias referred to.

Otherwise, this is NULL.

Parameters:
cnameOrigPageName got from system
Returns:
Is OrigPageName available?
int32_t gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getPersistentId ( )

The true identifier of this task, valid even if it is not running.

base::String gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getWebRuntimeAppId ( )

If it is webRuntime, return the webRuntime app's id.

Otherwise, return a null string.

base::String gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::getWebRuntimeAppName ( )

If it is webRuntime, return the webRuntime app's name.

Otherwise, return a null string.

bool gaia::core::RecentTaskInfo::isWebRuntime ( )

To check if this is a webRuntime task.
